architectural_notes: Public/anonymous users can browse all gallery content; authentication/profile is required only for write actions (uploading and interactions).
known_issues: Not all artists are listed (artists list appears incomplete).

existing_features.title: Allow all gallery browsing flows to work without requiring authentication or a completed user profile, including: viewing the Gallery page, viewing an Artwork details page, viewing the Artists list, and viewing an individual Artist profile page.

Change the profile setup gating so that the profile setup modal is not shown globally during normal browsing; instead, require a completed user profile only at the point of restricted actions (uploading content and interactions).

Require a completed user profile for interaction flows in the artwork experience (at minimum: submitting a purchase inquiry). If a user is not authenticated or has no profile, the UI must prevent the interaction and prompt them to log in and/or complete their profile.

Fix the issue where the Artists page does not list all expected artists by ensuring the frontend always renders the full set of artists returned by the backend and by resolving any filtering/caching logic that could cause the list to appear incomplete.

new_feature_requests.summary: Make all gallery content publicly viewable without a profile; require a profile only for uploading and interactions (like/ মন্তব্য/comment, etc.)

projectName: Make gallery public; require profile only for uploads and interactions
